infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container is running in host's PID namespace
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: The pod is sharing host's PID namespace
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Containers will be able to enumerate and interact with host's processes. This breaks container security boundary
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Remove `hostPID` attribute, or set value to `false`

remediation.kubernetes: Remove `hostPID` attribute, or set value to `false`
remediation.terraform: Remove `host_pid` attribute, or set value to `false`

iacDescription.issue: The pod is sharing host's PID namespace
iacDescription.impact: Containers will be able to enumerate and interact with host's processes. This breaks container security boundary
iacDescription.resolve: Remove `hostPID` attribute, or set value to `false`

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container is running in host's IPC namespace
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: The pod is sharing host's IPC namespace
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Containers will be able to communicate with host's shared channels. This breaks container security boundary.
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Remove `hostIPC` attribute, or set value to `false`

remediation.kubernetes: Remove `hostIPC` attribute, or set value to `false`
remediation.terraform: Remove `host_ipc` attribute, or set value to `false`

iacDescription.issue: The pod is sharing host's IPC namespace
iacDescription.impact: Containers will be able to communicate with host's shared channels. This breaks container security boundary.
iacDescription.resolve: Remove `hostIPC` attribute, or set value to `false`

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container is running in host's Network namespace
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: The pod is sharing host's Network namespace
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Containers will be able to access host's networking resources. This breaks container security boundary.
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Remove `hostNetwork` attribute, or set value to `false`

remediation.kubernetes: Remove `hostNetwork` attribute, or set value to `false`
remediation.terraform: Remove `host_network` attribute, or set value to `false`

iacDescription.issue: The pod is sharing host's Network namespace
iacDescription.impact: Containers will be able to access host's networking resources. This breaks container security boundary.
iacDescription.resolve: Remove `hostNetwork` attribute, or set value to `false`

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container's UID could clash with host's UID
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: `RunAsUser` value is set to low UID
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: UID of the container processes could clash with host's UIDs and lead to unintentional authorization bypass
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Set `securityContext.RunAsUser` value to greater or equal than 10000

remediation.kubernetes: Set `securityContext.RunAsUser` value to greater or equal than 10000
remediation.terraform: Set `security_context.run_as_user` value to greater or equal than 10000

iacDescription.issue: `RunAsUser` value is set to low UID
iacDescription.impact: UID of the container processes could clash with host's UIDs and lead to unintentional authorization bypass
iacDescription.resolve: Set `securityContext.RunAsUser` value to greater or equal than 10000

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Privileged container
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Container is running in privileged mode
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Compromised container could potentially modify the underlying host’s kernel by loading unauthorized modules (i.e. drivers).
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Remove `securityContext.privileged` attribute, or set value to `false`

remediation.kubernetes: Remove `securityContext.privileged` attribute, or set value to `false`
remediation.terraform: Remove `security_context.privileged` attribute, or set value to `false`

iacDescription.issue: Container is running in privileged mode
iacDescription.impact: Compromised container could potentially modify the underlying host’s kernel by loading unauthorized modules (i.e. drivers).
iacDescription.resolve: Remove `securityContext.privileged` attribute, or set value to `false`

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container does not drop all default capabilities
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: All default capabilities are not explicitly dropped
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Containers are running with potentially unnecessary privileges
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Add `ALL` to `securityContext.capabilities.drop` list, and add only required capabilities in `securityContext.capabilities.add`

remediation.kubernetes: Add `ALL` to `securityContext.capabilities.drop` list, and add only required capabilities in `securityContext.capabilities.add`
remediation.terraform: Add `ALL` to `spec.container.security_context.capabilities.drop` list, and add only required capabilities to `spec.container.security_context.capabilities.add`, ensuring it also does not contain `ALL`

iacDescription.issue: All default capabilities are not explicitly dropped
iacDescription.impact: Containers are running with potentially unnecessary privileges
iacDescription.resolve: Add `ALL` to `securityContext.capabilities.drop` list, and add only required capabilities in `securityContext.capabilities.add`

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container is running with docker socket mount
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Docker socket has been mounted inside the pod
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Access to docker socket from container can lead to container escape attacks and privilege escalation on the host

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Policy allows `privileged` containers
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Pods will be able to run with `privileged` mode.
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Remove `privileged` attribute, or set vault to `false`

remediation.kubernetes: Remove `privileged` attribute, or set vault to `false`
remediation.terraform: Remove `privileged` attribute, or set vault to `false`

iacDescription.impact: Pods will be able to run with `privileged` mode.
iacDescription.resolve: Remove `privileged` attribute, or set vault to `false`

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Policy allows privilege escalation
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Privilege escalation is not explicitly forbidden via `allowPrivilegeEscalation` attribute
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Pods will be able to run with `allowPrivilegeEscalation` set to true (default value).

iacDescription.issue: Privilege escalation is not explicitly forbidden via `allowPrivilegeEscalation` attribute
iacDescription.impact: Pods will be able to run with `allowPrivilegeEscalation` set to true (default value).

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Policy allows sharing of host's PID namespace
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Policy does not prevent containers from running processes inside of host's PID namespace
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Containers will be able to enumerate and interact with host's processes. This breaks container security boundary
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Remove `hostPID` attribute, or set value to `false`

remediation.kubernetes: Remove `hostPID` attribute, or set value to `false`
remediation.terraform: Remove `host_pid` attribute, or set value to `false`

iacDescription.issue: Policy does not prevent containers from running processes inside of host's PID namespace
iacDescription.impact: Containers will be able to enumerate and interact with host's processes. This breaks container security boundary
iacDescription.resolve: Remove `hostPID` attribute, or set value to `false`

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Policy allows sharing of host's IPC namespace
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Policy does not prevent containers from running processes inside of host's IPC namespace
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Containers will be able to communicate with host's shared channels. This breaks container security boundary.
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Remove the `hostIPC` attribute, or set value to `false`

remediation.kubernetes: Remove the `hostIPC` attribute, or set value to `false`
remediation.terraform: Remove the `host_ipc` attribute, or set value to `false`

iacDescription.issue: Policy does not prevent containers from running processes inside of host's IPC namespace
iacDescription.impact: Containers will be able to communicate with host's shared channels. This breaks container security boundary.
iacDescription.resolve: Remove the `hostIPC` attribute, or set value to `false`

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Policy allows sharing of host's Network namespace
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Policy does not prevent containers from running processes inside of host's Network namespace
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Containers will be able to access host's networking resources. This breaks container security boundary.
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Remove `hostNetwork` attribute, or set value to `false`

remediation.kubernetes: Remove `hostNetwork` attribute, or set value to `false`
remediation.terraform: Remove `host_network` attribute, or set value to `false`

iacDescription.issue: Policy does not prevent containers from running processes inside of host's Network namespace
iacDescription.impact: Containers will be able to access host's networking resources. This breaks container security boundary.
iacDescription.resolve: Remove `hostNetwork` attribute, or set value to `false`

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Policy does not prevent use of root user
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Policy explicitly allows `RunAsAny` user which allows container to run in root UID context
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Pods will be able to run with root UID.
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Set `runAsUser` to `MustRunAsNonRoot`, or exclude UID `0` from `MustRunAs` range

remediation.kubernetes: Set `runAsUser` to `MustRunAsNonRoot`, or exclude UID `0` from `MustRunAs` range
remediation.terraform: Set `run_as_user` to `MustRunAsNonRoot`, or exclude UID `0` from `MustRunAs` range

iacDescription.issue: Policy explicitly allows `RunAsAny` user which allows container to run in root UID context
iacDescription.impact: Pods will be able to run with root UID.
iacDescription.resolve: Set `runAsUser` to `MustRunAsNonRoot`, or exclude UID `0` from `MustRunAs` range

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Policy allows all capabilities
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: The whitelist of allowed capability is set to all
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: The pods will be allowed to add any capability at runtime, including SYS_ADMIN
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Remove `allowedCapabilities` attribute, or set value to `[]`

remediation.kubernetes: Remove `allowedCapabilities` attribute, or set value to `[]`
remediation.terraform: Remove `allowed_capabilities` attribute, or set value to `[]`

iacDescription.issue: The whitelist of allowed capability is set to all
iacDescription.impact: The pods will be allowed to add any capability at runtime, including SYS_ADMIN
iacDescription.resolve: Remove `allowedCapabilities` attribute, or set value to `[]`

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Policy allows any apparmor profile
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Default profile name is set to `unconfined`
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Pods will run with AppArmor disabled by default

iacDescription.issue: Default profile name is set to `unconfined`
iacDescription.impact: Pods will run with AppArmor disabled by default

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Policy sets insecure default seccomp profile
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Default seccomp profile is set to `unconfined`
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Containers will run with seccomp disabled

iacDescription.issue: Default seccomp profile is set to `unconfined`
iacDescription.impact: Containers will run with seccomp disabled

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: RoleBinding or ClusterRoleBinding is using a pre-defined role
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: A RoleBinding or ClusterRoleBinding was found using one of the default user facing roles, `cluster-admin`, `admin`, `edit` or `view`.
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Using a default user facing role may be overly permissive. For a ClusterRoleBinding this would be considered high severity.
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Update roleRef.name to a specific role name with only the necessary permissions.

iacDescription.issue: A RoleBinding or ClusterRoleBinding was found using one of the default user facing roles, `cluster-admin`, `admin`, `edit` or `view`.
iacDescription.impact: Using a default user facing role may be overly permissive. For a ClusterRoleBinding this would be considered high severity.
iacDescription.resolve: Update roleRef.name to a specific role name with only the necessary permissions.

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Using a default user facing role may be overly permissive. For a ClusterRoleBinding this would be considered high severity.
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Update roleRef.name to a specific role name with only the necessary permissions.

iacDescription.issue: A RoleBinding or ClusterRoleBinding was found using one of the default user facing roles, `cluster-admin`, `admin`, `edit` or `view`.
iacDescription.impact: Using a default user facing role may be overly permissive. For a ClusterRoleBinding this would be considered high severity.
iacDescription.resolve: Update roleRef.name to a specific role name with only the necessary permissions.

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Role with too wide permissions
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: The role uses wildcards, which grant the role permissions to the whole cluster
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: The use of wildcard rights grants is likely to provide excessive rights to the Kubernetes API.
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Set only the necessary permissions required

remediation.kubernetes: Set only the necessary permissions required

iacDescription.resolve: Set only the necessary permissions required

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container has no CPU limit
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: CPU limits can prevent containers from consuming valuable compute time for no benefit (e.g. inefficient code) that might lead to unnecessary costs. It is advisable to also configure CPU requests to ensure application stability.
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Add `resources.limits.cpu` field with required CPU limit value

remediation.kubernetes: Add `resources.limits.cpu` field with required CPU limit value
remediation.terraform: Add `spec.container.resources.limits.cpu` field with required CPU limit value

iacDescription.impact: CPU limits can prevent containers from consuming valuable compute time for no benefit (e.g. inefficient code) that might lead to unnecessary costs. It is advisable to also configure CPU requests to ensure application stability.
iacDescription.resolve: Add `resources.limits.cpu` field with required CPU limit value
